org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction

Class ThreadContextTransactionManager.NotSupportedTransaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction.ThreadContextTransactionManager.TransactionBase
      • org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction.ThreadContextTransactionManager.NotSupportedTransaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, TransactionScope
    Enclosing class:
    ThreadContextTransactionManager

    protected class ThreadContextTransactionManager.NotSupportedTransaction
extends ThreadContextTransactionManager.TransactionBase
    A transaction that implements the Propagation.NOT_SUPPORTED behavior, maintaining a reference to the suspended transaction so that it can be replaced when this is closed.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction.ThreadContextTransactionManager.TransactionBase

    • Method Detail

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws TransactionException
        Description copied from interface: TransactionScope
        Commits the transaction immediately. Transactions are committed atomically and durably, so that the instant this method returns successfully, the caller can be assured that the modifications performed by this transaction have been saved to disk.
        Throws:
        TransactionException - if an error occurred during the commit. The transaction manager will automatically revert the transaction upon a commit error.

      • revert

        public void revert()
        Description copied from interface: TransactionScope
        Reverts the transaction immediately. When a transaction is reverted, the database acts as though all the modifications performed inside the transaction scope never happened.
